comment._content: what an amazing photo! Countess get your Gun, Annie look out!

comment.author: 32586273@N03
comment._content: Great pic of a truly great woman

comment.author: 54160790@N07
comment._content: I'm a non-violence hippy type but she does look cool with her extravagant hat and gun. There should be a hollywood action movie about her life. I could just see Angelina Jolie in the lead role. :)

comment.author: 47290943@N03
comment._content: [http://www.flickr.com/photos/54160790@N07] Well, leaving guns out of it for a moment, the Countess was also a Suffragette; an artist; writer; war correspondent; first ever woman elected to the British parliament (1918) although she didn't take her seat...
comment.authorname: National Library of Ireland on The Commons

comment.author: 39191857@N05
comment._content: She was always one of my heroines but that photo makes me cringe!  Between the overdone uniform and the way she handles the gun it would make you question her mindset.  She is holding the gun with all the familiarity she apparently had with kitchen implements.  I do agree with Sheba78 however, her story would make a cracker of a film because she was a remarkable woman whatever her faults!

comment.author: 47290943@N03
comment._content: [http://www.flickr.com/photos/swordscookie] Perhaps if she looks a bit ham-fisted with the gun in this photo, it may be more due to the staged nature of a studio portrait, as she was no stranger to guns and certainly would have known how to use them. She's referred to as a "crack shot" in this article...
comment.authorname: National Library of Ireland on The Commons

comment.author: 7419373@N08
comment._content: What an extraordinary photo of an extraordinary woman.

comment.author: 47290943@N03
comment.authorname: National Library of Ireland on The Commons

comment.author: 40819165@N07
comment._content: Love this.

comment.author: 38197978@N02
comment._content: One thing she had in abundance—-physical courage; with that she was clothed as with a garment. -Seán O'Casey

comment.author: 99684904@N00
comment._content:
She would have known that the way she is told (?) to hold the revolver is totally silly.
It is a very odd way to hold it, even just for a pose.

comment.author: 21527219@N06
comment._content: She was indeed a crack shot and could certainly 'hold her own' with a weapon.

comment.author: 92877237@N02
comment._content: apparantly one of her famous quotes of the day was   if a woman wants to make a fashion statement today she should carry a gun..SWEET.

comment._content: Something I take quite a bit of pride in, she was also my great-great-grandmother's cousin.
